column4: If you install using this ppa you will not need root and have a icon.  https://launchpad.net/~artfwo/+archive/ppa
that ppa does not seem to have packages for precise. should I just try to manually install the 12.10 version?
Strange it skips from oneric to quantal, do you have the universe repo open in /etc/apt/sources.list
I think this is a deb that will work. http://pkgs.org/ubuntu-12.04/ubuntu-universe-i386/indicator-cpufreq_0.1.4-0ubuntu2_all.deb/download/
yes I have universe uncommented on source.list. OK I will give that I try. I think its the same one I have tho
How did you install the one you have.
Hmm, I have been using it for awhile never needing root it autostrats with the desktop.
hmm... maybe my user is supposed to be in a group that is not?
If you have admin I would think you are alright, not sure on permissions though.
I have been upgrading since 2009. maybe a setting didn't updated. yes I have admin
I'm also using low-latency kernel. I'm not sure if that makes a difference tho
I have no idea really, paths and permissions if I can describe loosely are not really an area I would have any info of without googling them.
someone in the forums said that it worked after a reboot. I will give that a try. thanks for the help!
it still requires sudo to work. I'm giving up for now.
